Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "There is a problem with the status update" (#981) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi, thanks for your work.

## When I add an attribute to an object in an array,there is a problem with the status update
`
let initialState = {
  linkmans = []
}
`

`
state.linkmans.forEach((item) => {
  item.lastWord = 'xxx'
})
`
Because i did not initialize，it doesn't work
## Then i do it 
`
state.linkmans = Immutable.fromJS(state.linkmans).toJS()
`
it works， but i feel that this writing is not elegant， i would like to know vuex in the operation of complex data when there is no better way to write. Or should Use immutable.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "There is a problem with the status update" (#981) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi, thanks for your work.

## When I add an attribute to an object in an array,there is a problem with the status update
`
let initialState = {
  linkmans = []
}
`

`
state.linkmans.forEach((item) => {
  item.lastWord = 'xxx'
})
`
Because i did not initialize，it doesn't work
## Then i do it 
`
state.linkmans = Immutable.fromJS(state.linkmans).toJS()
`
it works， but i feel that this writing is not elegant， i would like to know vuex in the operation of complex data when there is no better way to write. Or should Use immutable.
